application_data.air_pollution: Electrostatic precipitators installed, emissions within limits

issues.description: Consider installing rainwater harvesting system for sustainability

application_data.waste_management: Chemical waste storage on-site, disposal plan unclear

issues.description: Residential area within 500m buffer zone for chemical industries. Violates zoning regulations.
issues.regulation_reference: Industrial Zoning Act 2023, Section 4.2

issues.description: Fire safety certificate not submitted. Mandatory for chemical industries.
issues.regulation_reference: Fire Safety Rules 2024, Clause 8.1

issues.description: Hazardous waste disposal plan incomplete. Must specify authorized vendor details.
issues.regulation_reference: Hazardous Waste Management Rules 2024, Section 6

recommendations: Relocate facility or obtain special exemption
Submit fire safety audit report
Provide authorized vendor contract

issues.description: Dye waste treatment facility details unclear. Requires verification of authorization.
issues.regulation_reference: Water Pollution Control Rules 2024, Section 9.4

issues.description: Building plan approval not attached. Required for structures >30,000 sq ft.

recommendations: Submit waste treatment facility authorization
Provide building plan sanction letter
Clarify water consumption estimates

application_data.waste_management: E-waste to certified recycler, minimal other waste

issues.description: Fire suppression system specifications unclear. Data centers require FM-200 or equivalent.

issues.description: Diesel generator emissions data not provided. Required for backup power >500 KVA.

issues.description: E-waste recycler authorization certificate not attached
issues.regulation_reference: E-Waste Management Rules 2024

Provide generator emission test reports
Attach recycler authorization

application_data.water_source: Secured connection from KWA (Kerala Water Authority) Municipal Supply Line
application_data.drainage: All effluent will be treated in an on-site Effluent Treatment Plant (ETP) with a capacity of 50 KLD. Treated water will be reused for gardening purposes. Zero liquid discharge to public drains.
application_data.air_pollution: The boiler unit is equipped with a Wet Scrubber system to control particulate matter. Chimney height is maintained at 30 meters as per PCB norms.
application_data.waste_management: Biodegradable waste will be composted using a biogas plant. Non-biodegradable waste will be handed over to Clean Kerala Company Ltd.

issues.description: The application does not explicitly mention having a separate storm water drainage system. Although the ETP might handle this, it is recommended to confirm and document this.
issues.regulation_reference: Water Pollution Control (Chemical Industries) Rules, 2024, Section 3.2: Water Management, Clause 5

issues.description: The application does not provide information on the specific types and quantities of flammable materials being used in the GreenLeaf Processing Unit. This makes it difficult to determine if the correct fire extinguishers are available.
issues.regulation_reference: Kerala Industrial Safety Regulations 2023, Section 2.1: Fire Extinguishers, Clause 2

issues.description: The application states that treated effluent will be reused for gardening purposes, but it does not specify if all process water is being recycled. If only a portion of the water is being recycled, then this would represent a violation.
issues.regulation_reference: Water Pollution Control (Chemical Industries) Rules, 2024, Section 3.1: Zero Liquid Discharge (ZLD), Clause 3

missing_documents: The application does not explicitly mention having a separate storm water drainage system. Although the ETP might handle this, it is recommended to confirm and document this.
recommendations: Confirm and document the presence of a separate storm water drainage system
Determine the correct types and quantities of fire extinguishers based on flammable materials present in the facility
Investigate if all process water is being recycled within the plant premises

application_data.water_source: Secured connection from KWA (Kerala Water Authority) Municipal Supply Line
application_data.drainage: All effluent will be treated in an on-site Effluent Treatment Plant (ETP) with a capacity of 50 KLD. Treated water will be reused for gardening purposes. Zero liquid discharge to public drains.
application_data.air_pollution: The boiler unit is equipped with a Wet Scrubber system to control particulate matter. Chimney height is maintained at 30 meters as per PCB norms.
application_data.waste_management: Biodegradable waste will be composted using a biogas plant. Non-biodegradable waste will be handed over to Clean Kerala Company Ltd.

issues.description: The definition of 'Red Category' industries and the specific requirements for implementing ZLD need further clarification.
issues.regulation_reference: Water Pollution Control (Chemical Industries) Rules, 2024, Chapter 3: Effluent Discharge Standards > Rule 3: Zero Liquid Discharge

issues.description: The industrial unit's proposed ETP is expected to meet the heavy metal limits specified in the regulation.
issues.regulation_reference: Water Pollution Control (Chemical Industries) Rules, 2024, Chapter 3: Effluent Discharge Standards > Rule 4: Heavy Metal Limits

issues.description: The industrial unit has appropriate fire extinguishers installed and maintained as per the regulations.
issues.regulation_reference: Kerala Industrial Safety Regulations 2023, Chapter 2: Fire Safety Requirements > Section 2.1: Fire Extinguishers

issues.description: The industrial building has the required number and placement of emergency exits.
issues.regulation_reference: Kerala Industrial Safety Regulations 2023, Chapter 2: Fire Safety Requirements > Section 2.2: Emergency Exits

issues.description: The industrial unit falls under the applicability scope of Water Pollution Control (Chemical Industries) Rules, 2024.
issues.regulation_reference: Water Pollution Control (Chemical Industries) Rules, 2024, Chapter 1: Preliminary > Application

recommendations: Ensure clarification on 'Red Category' industries and ZLD implementation
Maintain regular inspections and maintenance of fire extinguishers
Implement and maintain emergency exit systems as per regulations

application_data.water_source: Secured connection from KWA (Kerala Water Authority) Municipal Supply Line
application_data.drainage: All effluent will be treated in an on-site Effluent Treatment Plant (ETP) with a capacity of 50 KLD. Treated water reused for gardening.
application_data.air_pollution: Boiler unit equipped with Wet Scrubber system to control particulate matter. Chimney height maintained at 30 meters.
application_data.waste_management: Biodegradable waste composted using a biogas plant. Non-biodegradable waste handed over to Clean Kerala Company Ltd.
application_data.nearby_homes: 750 meters away from the boundary wall

issues.description: It is unclear if the GreenLeaf Processing Unit has a valid certificate or approval for its air pollution control equipment. The regulation does not explicitly state that such certificates are required, but industry best practices suggest obtaining them to ensure proper functioning and compliance.
issues.regulation_reference: Water Pollution Control (Chemical Industries) Rules, 2024, Section 3.1: Air Pollution Control

issues.description: The GreenLeaf Processing Unit must submit quarterly waste management reports as required by the regulation. However, no such report was provided in the application.
issues.regulation_reference: Water Pollution Control (Chemical Industries) Rules, 2024, Section 3.3: Waste Management

issues.description: The GreenLeaf Processing Unit did not specify the exact location of its fire extinguishers in the application, making it difficult to determine if they are within the required distance.
issues.regulation_reference: Kerala Industrial Safety Regulations 2023, Chapter 2: Fire Safety Requirements, Section 2.1: Fire Extinguishers

issues.description: The GreenLeaf Processing Unit has a Boiler unit equipped with a Wet Scrubber system to control particulate matter and maintains a chimney height of 30 meters, which meets the requirements for controlling air pollution.
issues.regulation_reference: Water Pollution Control (Chemical Industries) Rules, 2024, Section 3.1: Air Pollution Control

missing_documents: The GreenLeaf Processing Unit must submit quarterly waste management reports as required by the regulation. However, no such report was provided in the application.
recommendations: Ensure proper functioning and obtain certificates for air pollution control equipment.
Submit quarterly waste management reports as required by the regulations.

application_data.water_source: Secured connection from KWA (Kerala Water Authority) Municipal Supply Line

application_data.air_pollution: The boiler unit is equipped with a Wet Scrubber system to control particulate matter. Chimney height is maintained at 30 meters as per PCB norms.

issues.description: GreenLeaf Processing Unit does not mention the submission of quarterly waste management reports in their application.
issues.regulation_reference: Water Pollution Control (Chemical Industries) Rules, 2024, Section 3.3: Waste Management

issues.description: It is unclear whether GreenLeaf Processing Unit falls under 'Light', 'Medium', 'Heavy' or 'Hazardous' industries, which impacts the required residential buffer zone.
issues.regulation_reference: Kerala Industrial Safety Regulations 2023, Section 4.1: Residential Buffer Zone

issues.description: As per regulation, every industrial building must have a minimum of two emergency exits on each floor.
issues.regulation_reference: Kerala Industrial Safety Regulations 2023, Section 2.2: Emergency Exits

missing_documents: GreenLeaf Processing Unit does not mention the submission of quarterly waste management reports in their application.
recommendations: Ensure submission of quarterly waste management reports
Determine the type of industry for GreenLeaf Processing Unit and verify residential buffer zone accordingly
Install appropriate number of emergency exits on each floor
